intro: Leucostele atacamensis subsp. pasacana, commonly known as the Atacama leucostele, is a rare and unique plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet in color. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native environment.
